title: Linux mesg Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux mesg command and learn how to send messages to terminal users, as well as restrict message receiving permissions. Gain practical knowledge for effective communication in a Linux environment.

verify.name: Verify message permission status
verify.hint: Ensure that the message permission status is set to 'y' to receive messages.

verify.name: Verify message sent to user
verify.hint: Ensure that the message "Hello, this is a test message." was successfully sent to the user.

verify.name: Verify broadcast message
verify.hint: Ensure that the broadcast message "This is a broadcast message to all users." was successfully sent.

verify.name: Verify message restriction for guest user
verify.hint: Ensure that the message receiving permission for the guest user is set to 'n' (no).

verify.name: Verify message permission restoration for guest user
verify.hint: Ensure that the message receiving permission for the guest user is set back to 'y' (yes).
